info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:51PM CDT until May 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
At 650 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing scattered showers and thunderstorms with light to moderate across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have estimated fallen along the Kimble and Menard county line eastward to Mason and Loyal Valley. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction, Mason, London, Yates Crossing, Katemcy, Hedwigs Hill, Hilda, Art, Loyal Valley, Pontotoc, Roosevelt, Koockville, Cleo and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line.
This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 435 and 459.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, Hurley crossing, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Spy Rock crossing, Vater crossing Hasse Creek, Old Pontotoc crossing Little Willow Creek and Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHERN KIMBLE AND MASON COUNTIES
